meanings.definition: The position or role of an executor.
meanings.sent1: In the executorship, he was responsible for carrying out the wishes of the deceased.
meanings.sent2: Her executorship of the will involved distributing the assets to the beneficiaries.
meanings.sent3: The executorship turned into a challenging but rewarding responsibility for him.
meanings.sent4: She handled the executorship with precision and care, like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The executorship required attention to detail and a sense of duty to fulfill the deceased's wishes.

meanings.definition: The act of executing or carrying out a task or duty.
meanings.sent1: His swift executorship of the project impressed the team.
meanings.sent2: The executorship of the plan was completed ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: She approached the executorship of the task with determination and focus.
meanings.sent4: The executorship of the mission was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The successful executorship of the duty brought a sense of accomplishment to the team.
